thobe.widgets.splitPanel

Interface SPContentFactory


  • public interface SPContentFactory
    This interface has to be implemented if you want to use the SplitPanel. This factory offers three different methods that will be called by the SplitPanel internally. E.g. if a frame should be splitted into two subframes the SplitPanel calls the method SPContentFactory#createContentForKey(String) to create a new instance of the frame that should be splitted.
    Author:
    Thomas Obenaus

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SPContent createContentForKey(java.lang.String key, int frameID)
      This method creates the content for a given key.
      void freeFrameID(int id)
      This method will be called if a SPFrame is deleted --> if its id is not needed any more.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getContentKeys()
      Returns a list of keys that represent the available content that can be created by this factory.
      java.lang.String getDefaultContentKey()
      This method returns a key for the default content a completely new subframe should be filled with.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns a name specifying the type of content this factory is able to provide.
      int getNewFrameID()
      This method should return a unique frame-id.

    • Method Detail

      • getContentKeys

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getContentKeys()
        Returns a list of keys that represent the available content that can be created by this factory.
        Returns:

      • createContentForKey

        SPContent createContentForKey(java.lang.String key,
                            int frameID)
        This method creates the content for a given key.
        Parameters:
        key - - the key identifying the content
        frameID - - the id of the frame the content should be created for. To be able to implement caching of frames content you need to know the frame the content is intended for.
        Returns:

      • getDefaultContentKey

        java.lang.String getDefaultContentKey()
        This method returns a key for the default content a completely new subframe should be filled with.
        Returns:

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns a name specifying the type of content this factory is able to provide.
        Returns:

      • getNewFrameID

        int getNewFrameID()
        This method should return a unique frame-id. This method is called every time a new SPFrame is created. The id will be used to identify the new frame. For example the method createContentForKey(String, int) will be called with this frameID. So you can use this id to implement caching of frames content.
        Returns:

      • freeFrameID

        void freeFrameID(int id)
        This method will be called if a SPFrame is deleted --> if its id is not needed any more. You can free this id.
        Parameters:
        id -
